intro: Hartmannia tarquensis, commonly known as the Tarquense velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
